I was mad.

For many people with chronic or long-term pain, opioids can seem like the difference between a full life or one lived in agony.
But until now, the best opioid drug trials lasted only six weeks or less, says researcher Erin Krebs.
From those studies we knew that opioids can improve pain a little bit more than a placebo or sugar pill in the short term.

Krebs is with the Minneapolis Veterans Administration Health Care System and the University of Minnesota.

Half were given opioids and half were given non-opioid painkillers like acetaminophen.
Doctors and patients knew what group they were in, says Krebs.
We found at the beginning of the study that patients who were enrolled really thought that opioids were far more effective than non-opioid medications.
